example.title: HTML Documents
example.text:
All HTML documents must start with a document type declaration: <!DOCTYPE html>.
The HTML document itself begins with <html> and ends with </html>.
The visible part of the HTML document is between <body> and </body>.

example.title: HTML Headings
example.text:
HTML headings are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags.
<h1> defines the most important heading. <h6> defines the least important heading:

example.title: HTML Horizontal Rules
example.text:
The <hr> tag defines a thematic break in an HTML page, and is most often displayed as a horizontal rule.
The <hr> element is used to separate content (or define a change) in an HTML page:
example.code:
<h1>This is heading 1</h1>
<p>This is some text.</p>
<hr>
<h2>This is heading 2</h2>
<p>This is some other text.</p>
<hr>

example.title: HTML Line Breaks
example.text:

example.title: HTML Background Color
example.text:
The background-color property defines the background color for an HTML element.
This example sets the background color for a page to powderblue:
example.code:
<body style="background-color:powderblue;">
<h1>This is a heading</h1>
<p>This is a paragraph.</p>
</body>

example.title: HTML Text Color
example.text: The color property defines the text color for an HTML element:
example.code:
<h1 style="color:blue;">This is a heading</h1>
<p style="color:red;">This is a paragraph.</p>

example.title: HTML Fonts
example.text: The font-family property defines the font to be used for an HTML element:
example.code:
<h1 style="font-family:verdana;">This is a heading</h1>
<p style="font-family:courier;">This is a paragraph.</p>

example.title: HTML Text Size
example.text: The font-size property defines the text size for an HTML element:
example.code:
<h1 style="font-size:300%;">This is a heading</h1>
<p style="font-size:160%;">This is a paragraph.</p>
